intro: Streblosa axilliflora, commonly known as the axillary-flowered streblosa, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit and features small, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of pink to white. The plant has alternate, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces, and its stems are often covered in fine pubescence. It is native to certain regions of South America and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
